name: potato production | potato | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15455/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of potato. The average yield from 2003 - 2013 is 15.5 t/ha. The data are representative for potato production in from northwest China, which is not representative for export. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 160-80-80 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 2 m3/ha of liquid manure and 2 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 2.76 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The share of potatoes produced in China amounts to 24% of the global production (tonnage produced in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing potatoes produced in China for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.5 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of potatoes at farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
Statistical data from FAO used to assess land use change is incomplete for China. The original land use of 40.9% of annual cropland and 100% of perennial cropland transformed in the last 20 years is unknown. Land use change impacts may therefore be underestimated.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Land use change (LUC) combines land transformation areas calculated with the adapted 'Direct Land Use Change Assessment Tool' version 2014 developed by Blonk Consultants and the carbon losses from soil organic carbon (SOC) and vegetation (VEG) as calculated in ecoinvent v3. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

flow.name: Transformation, from arable land, unspecified use

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'potato' is calculated to be circa 2.06E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.12E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[sulfonyl]urea-compound', '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'bipyridylium-compound', 'dithiocarbamate-compound', 'nitrile-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.56E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Corresponds to 1.07 m3/ha

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'potassium sulfate, as K2O' into 'potassium sulfate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0001 kg by 1.85 kg of 'potassium sulfate' per kg of 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Miles Harriman, Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Miles Harriman, Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 0.8 kg/ha
